dlgPart.npc_text: "How did it go?"

dlgAnsw.text: "I have convinced Antidas but he wants fifty thousand imperials."

dlgPart.npc_text: "He wants our money?" Linos' lips twist into a smile. "Splendid."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm not sure I understand."
[intelligence success]"Indeed. Once we start paying his bills, it's only a matter of time until we start telling him what to do."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Have you ever tamed a dog, <charname>? You give it a piece of meat. The dog likes the meat and comes for more. Before you know, the dog is eating out of your hand.
Well done, <charname>, well done. It's been a long day for you. Go rest and see me in the morning."

dlgAnsw.text: "Why do you need to control Antidas?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Have you ever tamed a dog, <charname>? You give it a piece of meat. The dog likes the meat and comes for more. Before you know, the dog is eating out of your hand.
This doesn't mean that we should throw our money at everyone, so don't expect me to pay every time you want to cut a few corners. No more notes, <charname>. Now go rest and see me in the morning."

dlgAnsw.text: "Why do you need to control Antidas?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"You've learned your lessons well, <charname>. You have a bright future ahead of you.
Now, it's been a long day for you. Go rest and see me in the morning."

dlgAnsw.text: "Why do you need to control Antidas?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"You've learned your lessons well, <charname>. You have a bright future ahead of you.
This doesn't mean that we should throw our money at everyone, so don't expect me to pay every time you want to cut a few corners. No more notes, <charname>. Now go rest and see me in the morning."

dlgAnsw.text: "Why do you need to control Antidas?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Have you heard the news yet? It was a very busy night. Commander Carrinas was assassinated. The Guards didn't take it well. They stormed the assassins' guild and burned it down, but didn't finish the job. Neleos and a few survivors infiltrated the barracks in the middle of the night and killed everyone in their path. None of them has made it out alive, unfortunately. As for the Imperial Guards, while I would have settled for less, Neleos' final gesture has presented us with an opportunity to deal with the Guards once and for all.
We can't let them rebuild – this much is clear. We can force the remaining Guards to join House Daratan, but I'm afraid to make Antidas too strong and thus too hard to control. Alternatively, we can convince Antidas to finish them off, but it's a waste of resources. Let's make it your call, <charname>."

dlgAnsw.text: Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: END - start MG3

"For the same reason we employ mercenary companies. Money is hard to make, but easy to lose; one must always be aware of potential threats. The biggest threat is always the Lords, for they can take everything in the blink of an eye. They could drown us in levies. Pay for this right, pay for that privilege, and before you know it, our profits are diverted to Antidas' treasury. They can seize our assets, claiming that we've conspired with the enemy. Considering that we do business with House Aurelian, it won't be a hard sell.
House Daratan is broke. While I'm sure Antidas will think twice before taking from us, if we leave him no choice, he'll do what he has to – as any man would. Only unlike any other man, he can do quite a lot and get away with it, simply because his blood is blue and ours peasant-red."

dlgAnsw.text: "You think it might come to it?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "It might, it might not. However, if we do nothing, we leave our fate to Antidas. That's something I just can't be comfortable with."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm sure that Antidas will be equally uncomfortable with your hand on his shoulder."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Uneasy lies the head that wears the crown," cites Linos. "I merely want to share that burden. If managed properly, both Teron and House Daratan could be so much more. Antidas dreams of battlefields and glory. He *needs* a capable administrator. We have the money, the reach, the experience. The time has finally come, <charname>."

dlgAnsw.text: "What do you think of Antidas?"
"Alright. I'll see you in the morning." Go rest.

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Antidas is a lord and like the rest of them he lives in his own world, far removed from reality. Great lords are aware of it and surround themselves with capable generals and administrators, heeding their counsel. Lesser lords believe in their own superiority and tend to dismiss opinions of others. Like Antidas.
"Well, if the hill won't come to you, you must go to the hill."

dlgAnsw.text: "What's your opinion of Gaelius and Meru then?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Gaelius has all the makings of a great lord. Unfortunately, he's too clever for his own good and that makes him more dangerous than Antidas and Meru combined.
"Antidas wants a larger piece of the pie. Gaelius wants it all and unless we find a way to stop him, he'll get there eventually. As for Meru, he's just an idiot."

dlgAnsw.text: "Just an idiot?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "That's what the reports I'm getting suggest. At first, I thought it was some clever ploy that I just couldn't grasp, but it does look like he believes in what he's preaching. He has no interest in anything but these gods of his."

dlgAnsw.text: "Gods?"
"So, he wasn't always a believer?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "The old stories about gods coming to save the Empire. All that nonsense."

dlgAnsw.text: "You don't believe in these stories then?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "<charname>, wasting time pondering if the stories we tell children are real is a luxury a guildmaster simply can't afford."

dlgAnsw.text: "You mentioned Meru... So, he wasn't always a believer?"
"Alright. I'll see you in the morning." Go rest.

dlgPart.npc_text: "There was a time when Meru was a reasonable man. As reasonable as you can expect a lord to be. Then, almost overnight, he became a zealot. Some say, literally overnight."

dlgAnsw.text: "Literally?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "When his father died of old age, Meru was taken into the bowels of Castle Ganezzar for some ritual. Keep in mind, it's House Crassus we're talking about. I don't think they can do anything without performing a ritual first. So, it's hardly surprising that they have a ritual for becoming a new Lord of their House. What's surprising and even ironic is that Meru's priorities shifted after the ritual. He doesn't even call himself a lord anymore."

dlgAnsw.text: "How do you know all that?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Forewarned is forearmed. We pay well for information. Some people are eager to work for us. Others may require a little push, like our new friend Mercato."

dlgAnsw.text: "Do the reports shed any light on what affected Meru so?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "The lower levels of Castle Ganezzar are sealed. Only a Lord of House Crassus and his retinue can enter. Considering the history of their House, they probably keep old relics there."

dlgAnsw.text: "The history of their House?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "It is said that their House played a key role in the Summoning that brought the High Lords to our aid. They built temples for these Lords and spent day and night there, learning from them."

dlgAnsw.text: "And then?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "And then the High Lords departed and the temples were sealed in wait of their return or something equally dramatic. It's not a subject I was ever interested in."

dlgAnsw.text: "Alright. I'll see you in the morning." Go rest.
